comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This statue (1842) was one of the first ever in Australia (!). It is now in front of the State Library in Macquarie Street, but in this photo it looks more like Hyde Park. Anyone know if it has been moved? More - www.publicartaroundtheworld.com/Sir_Richard_Bourke_Statue...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I love these pics of statues! Here's another pic from the Tyrrell Collection which shows the statue near the Domain gates www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=31595; Here's an item from the Argus which refers to a move in 1925...? possibly the move to its current location - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article2119754 ; Also note Henry Parkes' poem 'Sunrise, From Bourke's Statue', which Parkes wrote in 1850, when he was young and idealistic, before he entered politics - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article12918126

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Yes, my mistake about Hyde Park - probably because the State Library is not yet built in this photo. Evidently they planned to move the statue to align with the Library as early as 1911 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15292367 , but waited until 1925 for various reasons. Original position shown on this 1895 interactive map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=0...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: That map is good! I wondered where the old cricket ground was exactly.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Another view. No fence around the statue here - www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=28407

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Also see Conrad Martens' painting at acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=404944
